fields.description:
h2. Summary

'Filter files' search doesn't return the correct URL for files that are in a folder whose name has a space.
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a repo of yours
 # Create a file with path (the file belongs in a folder with a space in its name)
{code:java}
Test folder/file123456
{code}

 # Commit this file in the repo
 # Go to the *Source* page of the repo
 # In the field *Filter files*, search for 'file123456'
 # You will see the file listed below the field

h2. Expected Results

Clicking the link displayed in the results, opens the file in question.
 The URL should be
 [https://bitbucket.org/repo-owner/repo-slug/src/master/Test%20folder/file123456]
h2. Actual Results

Clicking the link displayed in the results, doesn't display the file contents.
 Instead, we see the message
{code:java}
Hmm... can't find that one
That file or directory doesn’t exist. Go back to the previous page and try another one.
{code}
The URL of the file is
{code:java}
https://bitbucket.org/repo-owner/repo-slug/src/master/Test%2520folder/file123456
{code}
Note the *25* in the URL, which breaks the link
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the folder this file belongs to from the repo's *Source* page and open it from there.
 Alternatively, remove the *25* part of the URL.
fields.summary: 'Filter files' search doesn't return the correct URL for files that are in a folder whose name has a space

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes a PR may have a diff that is too large for Bitbucket to display.
 In this case, customers cannot decline the PR from the UI, since the PR page won't load and will time out.
 Users would like to be able to decline such a PR from the UI.
h3. Suggested Solution

*1.* One thing that may work here is if the user has the option to decline a PR from the PRs page of the repo, without having to open the PR itself
 *2.* Another solution would be to load the PR page, even with the diff not displaying, so the user can decline this PR
h3. Workaround

Decline a PR via API:
 * [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/decline]
fields.summary: Allow users to decline a PR from the UI even when the diff is too large to display

fields.description:
h3. *Situation*:

If users have too many branches in their repo, they can maintain their repository by deleting unused branches.

The next step is to close/decline "Open" pull requests with those deleted branches as source branch.

h3. *Workaround*:
The only way to do this is by manually declining pull request in Bitbucket UI or identify all pull requests with the deleted source branch then use the API endpoint below.
{code:java}
/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}/decline{code}
[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/decline]

h3. *Feature request*
It would be great if we can decline/close open pull requests in bulk in this kind of situation.
Or probably add/update an API endpoint to filter pull requests with a deleted source branch
fields.summary: Bulk Decline Pull request

fields.description:
When switching to network option in Bitbucket, we see branch lines and at line end the branch name is displayed.
I think it will be very helpful in traversing branches if the branch name is displayed while hovering on the branch line.
fields.summary: Network : Branch name should be displayed on hover branch line

fields.description:
I can see/search other users, that are not on my team on the username alias page. Please implement the same behaviour like on the user invitation page.

There you said: 

*Repository access has changed*

*In order to improve user privacy, we have made changes to Bitbucket Cloud invitations. You must now enter an email address to add users who don’t currently have access to this account.*
fields.summary: Privacy Issue on "Username aliases": remove other users that are not in the team, like you do on the user invitation page

fields.description:
Users would like to have a graph of the repository size; after each push/commit is performed the repository size increases. Then, post re-setting the repository size decreases.
Users are looking for a capability where they can track this to monitor the size of the repository.

Suggestion:
- To have a size graph for each repository
- Dashboard with largest repositories with latest commits and ones crossing 2GB to flagged 
- Provide a re-fresh button in Repository settings section so that the latest size from remote server get's reflected on Bitbucket repository settings on the UI

Currently to find the repository:
- Option 1: Check the repository size from the repository settings
- Option 2: Clone the repository and look into the commits and determine the actual size
- Option 3: See the commit page on Bitbucket
fields.summary: Bitbucket Repository Size graph on the UI

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to use the following endpoint using the GET method to get the contents of a branch other than the main branch:
[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/src#get]

The documentation states that this is only for the main branch, currently.
fields.summary: Add the ability to use the username/repo_slug/src endpoint to branches other than the main branch

fields.description: Is it possible to create a feature that enables org admins to reset 2fa for their user's managed accounts?
fields.summary: Reset 2FA made by organization admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary


In new navigation pane when we hide the side toolbar, the icons of the side toolbar become hidden under the panel which would unwrap only after hovering thin gray line.

We need to first move the pointer to the thin gray line for opening side panel, then look for the icon you need and proceed with it.
h3. Expected Result


When we hide the side toolbar, the icons from it should be displayed on the sideline below the bitbucket logo.
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New navigation interface has icons hidden under the panel

fields.description: As for now, it is necessary to recreate a branch restriction for each newly created repository. It would be good to have the ability to set default branch permissions for newly created repositories or be able to manage the branch permission on an account level.
fields.summary: It would be good to have the ability to set default branch permissions for newly created repositories

fields.description: Due to the issues that the online editor has with non-ASCII character and identifying file encodings, it would be good to have the option to disable the editor to prevent issues on the repositories.
fields.summary: It would be good to have the ability to disable the online editor

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to prevent users from accidentally running a manual build that is still waiting to be run.

Currently, on Pipelines, you have the ability to manually trigger steps using the flag below:
{code:java}
  - step:     
    name: deploy     
    trigger: manual #this step will only be triggered by manually clicking on "Run" in the build
    script:
      - <commands>{code}

When this flag is enabled, Pipelines will wait for the user to click on the "Run" button to proceed to run this step.

 

The problem here is that it's not possible to cancel the ability to run the step, which means that, no matter how many builds you run after this build, it will still be waiting to be run.

 

This feature request is to add the ability to cancel this step, perhaps through a button on the user interface, which would not allow that step to run in the future.
fields.summary: Add the ability to prevent users from running a manual step if this step has already been run in a newer build

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's not possible to create a new repository when selecting the "Create repository" link on an empty team account's repository view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new team account
2. Once you are at Repositories section of the team, the following message will be prompted: "You don't have access to any recently updated repositories. Create repository instead or Import a repository from GitHub"
3. Click on the "Create Repository" link on this page.

h3. Expected Results
Be directed to https://bitbucket.org/repo/create and be able to create a new repository.

h3. Actual Results
The new page (https://bitbucket.org/repo/create/src) won't load and spinner spins forever with an error message on console: 

h3. Notes
The same issue does not occur for an empty individual account, where a different message will be prompted instead: "Here's where your work shines through
Set up a repository to get going with your code. After that, you’ll find your relevant repositories and work right here."

h3. Workaround
Create a repository for the team account by clicking on the "+" icon on the sidebar to the left.
fields.summary: The "Create repository" link on an empty team account's repository view does not work

fields.description:
Hi

I have this fantstic 28" 4k monitor - just to get this from Bitbucket Documentation:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

I suggest that you either
 * make the tables wrap their content as does the text above them
 * make the columns a lot wider.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Formatting Problems in BitBucket Documentation

fields.description: !https://i.ibb.co/wJKMQ8c/feedback.png!
fields.summary: Make app names more prominent

fields.description:
The suggestion is for a feature to enhance the security and access control options on Bitbucket Cloud:
- Provide Region based IP filtering
- MAC filtering
- Provision of VPN tunnel over an encrypted network

At the moment Bitbucket offers the IP whitelisting and enforces 2FA for every user trying to login.
fields.summary: Request for MAC Filtering and further enhancements with Security features

fields.description: Please add a POST method so it’s possible to create a version through the API.
fields.summary: Create version through API

fields.description:
Bitbucket is difficult to use in a phone or tablet. We often have to log issues in a meeting or at the desk of a user and we don't always carry around a laptop to do it. Having a PWA version would make it possible to install it on a mobile device and would let us log issues on the fly.

The current UI is not responsive and doesn't realize well for use in a phone.

Having an offline mode would make it possible to log issues and plan projects when we don't have a connection.
fields.summary: Create responsive PWA version of bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, we can only add a member to a group via API 1.0 by providing UUID only.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/groups-endpoint-296093143.html

*Feature request*: It would be best to accept an email address as payload when adding a member to a group via REST API.
fields.summary: Add an email address to group REST API call

fields.description:
Add the ability to import the repository settings in Bitbucket Cloud. 

For example, when you import a repository, all settings should be imported as well, such as branch permissions, deployments, etc.

Have to copy it over and over again gets old quickly.
fields.summary: Import repository settings

fields.description:
dropbox papers is very handy because you can add checkboxes like these (screenshot below) by clicking to create a new one, to which you can then add text.

!515500933-image.png|thumbnail!\\
dropbox papers also offers text, images and many of the things that bitbucket issues offers to authors.

we would like to see Bitbucket add this ability to add to issues. it would be very helpful for teams making software. the person working on that issue can then checkoff the individual items in an issue. the creator of the issue can go back and make sure the person who fulfilled that issue checked off every item or can see that certain ones weren’t finished and therefore that issue is not completely resolved. there is no way currently to consistently do this useful function. checkboxes would help the person working on the issue to know that they have finished each item or to add info on why they haven’t.

please add checkboxes to issues. it would greatly add to the abilities within issues.

thanks
fields.summary: add optional checkboxes for use when writing up issues

fields.description:
After accessing bitbucket I go to settings and open the page with options, enter security and enter the current and new password. When I confirm I get the warning that the current password is incorrect, but it is the same as the one I entered on access.\\
I can't change the password and in the repository clone I also get the invalid login message.
fields.summary: Password change does not work
Add SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH environment variable

fields.description:
Hi,

I’ve been using Bitbucket for a while, and in the web page I always check the branches, when I aprove them, I merge them into master. The problem is that the changes are not really merged, and they are lost. Here’s an example. I meant to merge those changes in master, but when I check the file, the changes are lost.

‌

I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong. In the attachment there are the steps I followed.
fields.summary: Merge into master not showing in master commits

fields.description:
Change remote url in empty repo placeholder text to HTTPS when HTTPS is selected from the dropdown. Otherwise you will run into issues.

‌

Should be: `git remote set-url origin https://……………….`
fields.summary: Change remote url in empty repo placeholder to HTTPS when HTTPS is selected from the dropdown

fields.description:
Currently, approving/unapproving a pull request is as easy as pressing a button. There is no confirmation if you really wish to approve/unapprove that PR, you just click the button and it approves/unapproves it for you.

This can be troublesome since approving PRs by accident can potentially bypass branch permissions that require a certain number of approvals, for example. Additionally, users can also accidentally unapprove PRs, and due to this, the PR needs to be re-approved in order to merge.

This feature request is to add a pop-up text to ask if the user really wishes to approve the PR in question. This feature request is also to add a pop-up to confirm if the user wishes to unapprove the PR, in order to prevent accidental unapprovals.
fields.summary: Pull request approvals confirmation

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I have a use case to commit files using api and it is available in 2.0 ref: ([https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/src#post|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/src#post])

This works on cloud but i have a Bitbucket instance on-premise and only 1.0 api’s available. tried on both (v6.4.3 & v6.6.1)

Any plans to ship 2.0 apis in future releases??
fields.summary: Availability of 2.0 API in Bitbucket on premise

fields.description:
Here is what I'm seeing when try to access {{Source}} tab in the repository right now. {{~30}} minutes ago that same repository was operational and working just fine.

Also it turns out the issue affect API, since my Continuous Integration tool is not able to fetch files from the repository anymore.

!2204841477-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Having trouble showing that directory

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test account and invite it to a repository
# Login as the test account and create a pull request in the repository
# Delete the test account
# Login as an original owner of the repository and try to merge the pull request

h2. Expected Results
The pull request can be merged to the destination branch.

h2. Actual Results
The _Merge_ button keeps snipping, and the request receives an error like below:

* Request: GET [https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/ymkjp/samplie/pullrequests/tasks/8df1902f-852b-4999-8892-8b4c709453eb?_=1567564506192|https://bitbucket.org/%21api/1.0/repositories/ymkjp/samplie/pullrequests/tasks/8df1902f-852b-4999-8892-8b4c709453eb%3F_%3D1567564506192]

{code}
{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "We are unable to retrieve commit author information at the moment. Please try again later."}}
{code}

h2. Workaround
Recreate a pull request as a different user.

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

h2. Bugfix Policy
At the moment, Atlassian can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.\\
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
fields.summary: Pull request created by a deleted user cannot be merged

fields.description: In the new and old pull request screen, text within {{<ins>}} or {{<del>}} are not visible to browser find (command+F) when using Google Chrome. It does work in Firefox.
fields.summary: Browser find (command-F) doesn't work on text that has been highlighted by word diff

fields.description:
An user which has a free plan can upgrade the account plan to Premium without an issue, but if you try to revert back from premium to free, although you select free in the plan change screen, the plan won't change.

As a workaround you have to change your plan to standard, and then to free.
fields.summary: Premium plan users cannot change directly to free plan

fields.description: Not able to open a commit

h3. Issue Summary
When there are two repositories with the same name and the only difference is a '.git' extension, Bitbucket will only show the repository _without_ .git extension even when the repository name _with_ .git extension is used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two repositories with the same name where one also has a '.git' extension.
 # Reference the repository with the .git extension using UI or from a git client.

h3. Expected Results
The repository with .git extension should be shown when the repository with .git extension is used in the UI or Git client.

h3. Actual Results
The repository _without_ .git extension is shown when the repository with .git extension is used in the UI or Git client.

h3. Workaround
Avoid this problem by not adding .git to repository names.
fields.summary: Bitbucket refers to the repository without .git extension when with .git extension is referred

fields.description:
The BB search does not work since yesterday. Yesterday morning, 1 of my 2 open BB tabs refused searching for repositories and code, while it still worked in the other tab.

But now, it stopped working all together. I also tried in a private browser session, but same there

‌

KR

Rik
fields.summary: Searching for repositories and code not working

fields.description:
When using VPN it’s faster to access Bitbucket directly. So I tried to setup an exception for it. However there is too many domain names that are accessed which means it’s difficult to make a simple rule for VPN bypass. I propose to host all javascript files in the [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org] domain, or a subdomain so I can just add simple rules like *.bitbucket.org & bitbucket.org.

I wanted to add my huge rule set here, but I guess it was detected as spam as it’s lots of domain names that Bitbucket accesses. You can see list by doing inspect element and refresh any page on Bitbucket and filter for unique domain names. Quite a bit, I’m sure a bunch aren’t necessary as some look like tracking.
fields.summary: Access from china too many rules to add for exceptions

fields.description:
It would be great to have a shortcut to go to the different areas in bitbucket.

In my use-case, I switch between “Pull requests” and “Pipelines” quite often. It would be great if there was a shortcut for those.

_As an extended request, if there was a way to open a particular Pull request once you are on that window … key + 1-9 for the first 9 might be a good start._
fields.summary: Shortcuts to main areas - Source, Commits, Branches, Pull Requests, Pipelines

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to perform two deployment builds to the same environment at the same time.\\
When you try this, the following message will show up:\\
This pipeline was paused because another pipeline was deploying to Test.

The build will stay paused in this state, and a "resume" button will show up.\\
If there are deployment branch restrictions active, the resume button will stay grayed out, and will not allow you to proceed with the deployment.

Steps to reproduce:

# Add the following configuration on your yml:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
     - step:
        script:
         - echo a
     - step:
        deployment: test
        script: 
          - echo a
  pull-requests:
     '**':
     - step:
             script:
              - echo a
     - step:
             deployment: test
             script: 
               - echo a
{code}

2 . Go to your repo settings > Deployments > This happens for any environment, but in this case, for testing purposes, select the "test" environment >Add any branch to the "Branches allowed to deploy to Test:" textbox

3 . Create a new branch, and add a commit to it. This commit should trigger a build As soon as the commit is added, before the build that gets triggered by the commit ends, go to the pull requests page and create a new PR for the created branch

4 . This will trigger two builds. The build that finishes first will be able to deploy to the environment whereas the other build will get blocked with the following error:\\
*This pipeline was paused because another pipeline was deploying to <environment>.*

This is expected. However, even after the deployment ends, the "Resume" button will never allow you to deploy to the Test environment, and this is the issue here.

A workaround for this is to remove any deployment branch restrictions you may have on your repo. The "Resume" button will not be greyed out anymore.
fields.summary: Resume button will stay greyed out if branch restrictions are enabled for builds that deploy to the same environment

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to query the Hooks API result.

{code}
#!python

/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/hooks
{code}

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/hooks#get

As per the official documentation, API 2.0 only supports querying for:

* Repositories
* Pull requests
* Issues
* Refs, tags, bookmarks

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/filtering

*Feature request*:\\
It would be best we can also filter the Hooks GET API result.
fields.summary: Query Hooks API

fields.description:
In the past, team accounts can be associated with email addresses which the user can use to directly login into the team account.

However, Bitbucket Cloud has already deprecated team account logins as stated in https://confluence.atlassian.com/bbkb/team-account-changes-454361799.html

The problem is that when old and returning users from before the deprecation occurred tries to login into their team accounts, the login page will be stuck in a infinite loop with the message of "OpenID transaction in progress" without any results.

My suggestion is that an error message should be prompted to alert the user that they're trying to login into a team account and team accounts cannot be login into.
fields.summary: An error message should be displayed when trying to login into team accounts.

fields.description:
Hey Devs,

I would like to have an option or a plugin to use in Bitbucket to add Upvote/Downvote actions for Bitbucket code reviews.

The idea is to upvote the best code review comments and get them the higher visibility for the review and the reviewer, and downvote if its bad review.

The purpose is to educate junior devs to pick the best comments and avoid bad practices.

Thanks.

Aruna
fields.summary: Upvote / Downvote option for Bitbucket review comments

fields.description:
Hi!

I faced with case where I lost all the commits for almost all the branches. I worked on branch removing-pattern-recognition-properties and I had several commits already (they were displayed on bitbucket). After that I merged origin/develop into my branch, resolved the conflicts and committed\pushed the changes. After that I noticed, that Bitbucket showed me, that there are no any commits for my branch. Also I noticed, that for other branches it shows the same. I have no rights to commit directly to develop branch. Screenshot from Bitbucket and git logs are attached.

Locally everything looks fine: I have commits in history. If I checkout branch from the repo - commits are lost.

‌

I created removing-pattern-recognition-properties-new branch from my last commit. After it it shows the changes on click, but still shows incorrect number of commits in Behind column.
fields.summary: Commits for branches were lost

fields.description:
Filtering repository owners in Repositories tab is broken as by typing the team’s name, it may not find the actual team.

Workaround:  Avatar > View All teams > click on the team see the repos from > will be taken to the list of repos owned by that team.
fields.summary: Filtering repository owner in Repositories tab is broken

fields.description: Unable to merge a particular pull request
fields.summary: Unable to merge pull request

fields.description:
When merging a pull request Bitbucket, by default, creates automated commit message like this:

{code}
Merged in CS-566 \([PR#1054|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/1054]\)
CS-566: General tab is not opening when Additional Liabilities - Loan is selected
…
{code}

It starts with *Merged in …* which is not meaningful enough. We would like to customize the default behavior so that the second line become first. In the example above, the first line of the message should be _*CS-566: General tab …*_

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Change default commit message when merging

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to provide commands to Pipelines services. If a command needs to be executed before starting the service for your case scenario, you would need to build your own Docker image.

This feature request is to add the ability to provide parameters for the service to run before starting.
fields.summary: Allow passing commands to services in Pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Assume a Bitbucket user that has the following type of access to 2 repos:

* repo-1 / the user has read access
* repo-1-fork (fork of repo-1) / the user has write access

If this user opens a PR from repo-1-fork to repo-1, with the Old PR experience, it is possible for this user to Edit the PRs he is the author of and also Decline them.\\
With the new PR experience, those options are removed.

This is an issue for some users, because sometimes PR authors need to change the Title and the Description of the PRs they have opened themselves. They sometimes may also need to Decline a PR because it's no longer needed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow PR authors to Edit and Decline the PRs they have opened, even if they have read-only access to the destination repo.
fields.summary: Allow PR authors with read-only access to the destination repo to Edit and Decline the PRs they open

fields.description:
When I add my host (in SSH keys pipelines setting) and try to fetch its fingerprint I get the following error message:

“Unable to fetch fingerprints, check host SSH connection and try again.”

I’ve managed to get the fingerprint with ssh-keyscan from command line, so the host I input is definitely correct and available.

I need to set up a deployment pipeline and it is crucial for me to be able to scp/ssh in my pipeline steps.

Please address this issue.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Unable to fetch host's fingerprint

fields.description: Instead of showing a message stating that the environment does not support WindowsOS images, Pipelines gets stuck forever on the build setup phase.
fields.summary: WindowsOS images being used on Pipelines get stuck forever

fields.description:
Some international keyboards don't have a dedicated backtick {{`}} character, but instead have a "dead key" which is also used to enter characters with accents like è. If a user attempts to enter some preformatted text using dead keys the editor does not detect these properly. On a mac keyboard you can simulate this by hitting Option + ` at the same time.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Press option and backitck at the same time - this should appear as a backtick character that is underlined
# Type in a word (e.g. hello)
# Press option and backtick again
# Press space

*Expected results*\\
We see the preformatted word: 'hello'

*Actual results*\\
The editor instead shows: {{ello}}

This issue is impacting users trying to comment on pull requests in Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: "Dead keys" not handled correctly (e.g. when entering preformatted text)

fields.description:
Hi,

I haven’t found a way to import a deployment environment’s variables from one repository to another.\\
Is this possible?\\
If not, it would be a nice enhancement.

Nicolas
fields.summary: Transfer a deployment environment's variables between repositories

fields.description:
As per the title, deployment branch permissions (https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/admin/addon/admin/pipelines/deployment-settings) are case sensitive.

On the "Branches allowed to deploy to <enviroment>:" box, if you use a pattern like "feature/*", any branch named "Feature/*" will not be able to deploy to <environment>.

A workaround for this is to remove the lower case permission and add an uppercase permission to exactly match the branch name.
fields.summary: Deployment permissions are case-sensitive

fields.description: not an expert on this, but shouldn’t rel=”nofollow” which is on all Bitbucket links be removed on internal Bitbucket wiki (those within bitbucket.org).  i’d think this would de-weight all Bitbucket wiki pages from search engines, because no page hierarchy would be visible to them.
fields.summary: remove rel="nofollow" on internal links?

fields.description:
{code}
pipelines:
  pull-requests:
    '**':
{code}

returns

!3176947538-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

instead full form like within branch driven pipeline

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
{code}

!831595848-image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected:
Always return full form.
fields.summary: BITBUCKET_COMMIT returns short form instead full for `pipelines.pull-requests:`

fields.description:
When I’m trying to edit the comment, system is not saving the changes. Also when we click on edit again sometimes it opens new input box.

Please refer: [https://Companyhub.tinytake.com/tt/MzcwODU4Ml8xMTI3NTcyMA|https://Companyhub.tinytake.com/tt/MzcwODU4Ml8xMTI3NTcyMA]

P.S. I refreshed the page and then it worked.
fields.summary: Editing the comment is not working sometimes

fields.description:
Usually this updates pretty much immediately, but It’s been 10 minutes and no change to the PR.

The branch the commit was pushed to is the source branch of the PR.
fields.summary: Commit shows in branch but not appearing in PR (nor is the diff updated)

fields.description: The Bitbucket Labs beta for the “embedded HTML in markdown” takes something simple like: test and turns it into test it seems to override any HTML even for internal Bitbucket links.
fields.summary: Embedded HTML in markdown overrides attributes of links

fields.description:
On the Pull Request Interface, you include a column of To Do’s if those have been set in the comments on a PR. To Do’s are awesome, but the interface doesn’t effectively show if it was done or not. Presently, if they are incomplete, it shows the number of them with a checked-off box icon. Once they are completed, that indicator goes away. I would like to see that checkbox always (so we don’t have to remember via the interface which ones used to have To Do’s), but if:

* None are complete, then show it as an unchecked box.
* Some, but not all, are complete, then show it with a partically complete box (sort of greyed out in the middle, like when you have previously selected some, but not all, of a list of checkbox items and are trying to “select all” maybe?)
* All are complete, then show it as a checked box (the way it displays now even when none of them are actually done)
fields.summary: Pull Request Interface: Change Display of To Do Items

fields.description:
Projects are a great way to organise team repositories.

I’d like to see a “Project name” column on the Repositories list and to filter/sort by project name.
fields.summary: Add the Project column in the Team Repository list

fields.description:
Allow for users to customize the Bitbucket Dashboard with the following:

* Sorting of repositories
* Notifying for pending pull requests
* Allow for custom notifications

We do have users requesting for flexibility with dashboard information and would like the UI to have more information then it’s currently serving
fields.summary: Bitbucket Dashboard customization Options

fields.description:
obremskyi.v@ajax.systems

bezpartochnyi.b@ajax.systems

These users can receive emails from other services/people but not from bitbucket. Possibly they’re in bounce list
fields.summary: Cant invite new users to repository or team

fields.description:
Problem.

* Create a repo. Name: foobar
* Enable wiki and observe link to it is foobar.git/wiki
* Rename the repo. New Name: foo
* Observe link to wiki repo still relates to: foobar.git/wiki even thou the owner repo has changed name.

Expecation:

Link to wiki should always reflect the current name of the original repository.\\
From above the expectation would be: foo.git/wiki

Findings:

the repo link to wiki always relates to the name of the owner repo as it was when the wiki was activated. The wiki link will not change after that regardless of renaming the owner repo.
fields.summary: Wiki repo maintains the name of the original repository even tho it has been renamed

fields.description:
h2. Expected Behavior
Strikethrough formatting is applied to markdown document by enclosing text with {{~~}}.

h2. Actual Behavior
The rendered text is enclosed by {{<del>}} and {{</del>}}, instead of formatting.

!3733503224-Screen_Shot_2019-08-28_at_12_31_35.png|thumbnail!\\
!79986029-Screen_Shot_2019-08-28_at_12_28_27.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Strikethrough is appeared as <del> instead of formatting

fields.description: {{Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status}}[https://bitbucket.org/repo/create/src?state=view|https://bitbucket.org/repo/create/src%3Fstate%3Dview]{{of 404 ()}}
fields.summary: Can't create repository under my team. Chrome 76

fields.description: There should be a flag in the PR list to show if a PR has conflicts. Similarly to how we can see at a glance if there are build failures.
fields.summary: Easily see if Pull-Requests within the list view contain conflicts

fields.description: Currently you can require issue keys in commit messages at the repository level, this does not fit all use cases.  Add the option to enable this feature at the branch level so not all branches in the repository need to have this requirement.
fields.summary: Allow Jira issue requirements to be set at the branch level

fields.description: Once a folder named _browse_ is created under the wiki repository, it will not be possible to access the files under it, nor getting it deleted. It seems this is happening because Bitbucket uses browse as a root URL. Cloning the wiki repo and deleting the file locally resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Unable to access or delete wiki folders named as 'browse'

fields.description:
As per the title, the Slack bot, when added to a Slack room, will always throw the message in the screenshot.

!3651294484-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-27%20at%2015.14.38.png|thumbnail!

This message looks like an actual notification that Bitbucket would send when a PR is approved.

This feature request is to change the name of the user on that message, as well as the name of the reviewers to something like "Bitbucket User", to be clear that this is not an actual message from a repo.
fields.summary: Slack bot example should be more obvious

fields.description:
Hi all,

‌

trying to figureout is there any way to make docker images definition and can’t find anything,

could anybody provide me plz example?

‌

thanks
fields.summary: images definition

fields.description:
The overall issue is a pipeline job fails but the only message we see in the log is::\\
{{time="2019-08-26T20:41:01Z" level=error msg="error waiting for container: unexpected EOF"}}

The job only ran for 3 min 37 sec but we are using the def time of 120m.

‌

In the attached screen shot, you can see the dialog that says:\\
Container 'docker' exceeded memory limit.

Since the pipeline was configured with following and a standalone execution of the job shows we are using less than 740Mb of memory, then the above message does not make sense.\\
{{options: docker: true size: 2x}}\\
and:\\
{{definitions: services: docker: memory: 4096}}
fields.summary: pipeline prematurely failing with no details

fields.description: code search return internal server error
fields.summary: code search return internal server error

fields.description: When branch name contains ‘#’ char and I’m trying to create a pull request from JIRA, the ‘#’ is not encoded and the correct branch is not selected. Trying to create the pull request from Bitbucket itself work properly as the ‘#' char is encoded and the url source parameter is correct.
fields.summary: Creation of pull request does not select the correct branch

fields.description:
It would be great if Bitbucket Cloud allows us to have the functionality of granting users the read-only access to my private repositories without allowing them the ability to pull, clone, import, fork or print.

A similar comparison will be Adobe Acrobat, where users are able to view the text, but they won’t be able to copy or print it without a password.
fields.summary: Allow us to restrict all forms of copying repository contents by other users.

fields.description:
Currently it seems that admins can circumvent merge checks as set in Branch Permissions. Specifically, I have a repo where I’ve set as check at least 1 approval, but it seems that admins can nonetheless approve and merge their own PRs.

I don’t see why I should want that as default, let alone as my unique option: there’s no point in PRs if the creator can be the one who approves them, and indeed by default Bitbucket only counts _external_ approval (the creator’s doesn’t normally count). This should also be the case when the PR creator is a repo admin.
fields.summary: merge checks should apply to admins too

fields.description:
In an organisation with a lot of repositories it would help to have an default organisation pull request template. Either per complete organisation or per “project” (group of repositories).

This makes management of lists of tasks within pullrequests a lot easier for an organisation with a lot of repositories.
fields.summary: Set organisation or project default pullrequest template

fields.description:
The current pullrequest template is rather lacking in a few ways. First of, please make it possible to manage the template for a project in code as with Github.

[https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-pull-request-template-for-your-repository|https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-pull-request-template-for-your-repository]
fields.summary: Manage the pullrequest template from code

fields.description:
Using side-by-side diff and ignoring whitspace is the most efficient way for me to use Bitbucket. Unfortunately, it keeps forgetting these settings when I switch between PRs. (I’m quite sure the behaviour changed with the last update.)

This is a huge nuisance and a daily cause of frustration.

Please make Bitbucket

a) remember the last settings _or_

b) let me configure my preferred default settings in the account settings.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Configurable default Diff Options

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a branch and make at least one commit
* Create a pull request for the branch with at least one reviewer
* Reviewer approves pull request which generates an email notification to the author of the pull request
* Make another commit on the branch, this removes the approval
* Reviewer approves the pull request for the second time
* An email notification is NOT sent to the pull request author

Another issue here is that activity feed for the pull request does not show two approvals
fields.summary: Email Notification not working when Pull Request is reapproved

fields.description:
In edit mode here:

[https://bitbucket.org/archlabslinux/installer/issues/6/zshrc-doesnt-set-histfile|https://bitbucket.org/archlabslinux/installer/issues/6/zshrc-doesnt-set-histfile]

CTRL-SHIFT-V causes the whole page to redirect to [google.com|http://google.com], instead of pasting.

Should be plain-text paste.
fields.summary: Plain-text Paste Opens Google Search

fields.description: Kokua Team has ~50 hg repositories. Most all have  a Downloads section with Library archives. Is there a way when we convert these to git to run a background task to transfer the Downloads from hg to git?
fields.summary: Kokua Team

fields.description:
This week I’ve noticed a new bug in PRs for Bitbucker Cloud. Newly Added files in a Pull Request are not showing contents. They are showing as if they are collapsed even if I toggle the expand arrow several times.

I am using the stable PR Experience (Non-beta), which I prefer because we rely on PR Tasks for our workflow which are not supported in the beta version..
fields.summary: Added Files in Pull Requests are not displaying content

fields.description:
!1367446464-image.png|thumbnail!\\
When using chrome to watch the pipeline build console CPU utilisation goes to 100%. Over time performance degrades until scrolling on that tab or expanding build log steps is impossible. Closing the tab brings the CPU utilisation back down to normal.
fields.summary: 100% browser CPU utilisation on pipeline build console page.

fields.description:
Output from the build setup step is smeared across the output for the following steps, shunting output from those steps further down the page. I would expect all the output from the build setup step would be captured inside the drop-down for that step.

The logs are sensible when I look at the downloaded pipelineLog file.

Here’s a snippet of code producing output necessary to debug the pipeline that gets drowned out by the output from the build setup step.

{code}
-   CHANGES=$(git diff --name-only master -- *.hpp *.cpp *.sh *.yml *.conf )
-   if [ -z "$CHANGES" ]; then
-     echo Not building C++ code for this PR validation; nothing has changed from master.
-     exit
-   fi
-   echo Running tests on C++ code because the following has changed from master
-   echo -------------------------------------------------------
-   for f in $CHANGES; do echo $f; done
-   echo -------------------------------------------------------
- fi
- if [[ ($PLATFORM == *32b) && ($VARIANT != *32b) ]]; then
-   # The platform is 32b, but we're not building a 32b variant. Fix that.
-   export VARIANT=${VARIANT}32b
- fi
- echo Syncing s3://<s3bucket>/$PLATFORM-$BITBUCKET_BRANCH to $CCACHE_DIR
{code}

‌

!2933490542-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket CI pipeline console output completely broken

fields.description:
The Markdown Wiki renderer fails to handle alternating ordered/unordered list types that are standardized by CommonMark. [Permalink to markdown-it example|https://markdown-it.github.io/#md3%3D%257B%2522source%2522%253A%2522%2523%2523%2520Lists%255Cn%255CnUnordered%255Cn%255Cn%252B%2520Create%2520a%2520list%2520by%2520starting%2520a%2520line%2520with%2520%2560%252B%2560%252C%2520%2560-%2560%252C%2520or%2520%2560%252A%2560%255Cn%252B%2520Sub-lists%2520are%2520made%2520by%2520indenting%25202%2520spaces%253A%255Cn%2520%2520-%2520Marker%2520character%2520change%2520forces%2520new%2520list%2520start%253A%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%2520%252A%2520Ac%2520tristique%2520libero%2520volutpat%2520at%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%2520%252B%2520Facilisis%2520in%2520pretium%2520nisl%2520aliquet%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%2520-%2520Nulla%2520volutpat%2520aliquam%2520velit%255Cn%252B%2520Very%2520easy%21%255Cn%255CnOrdered%255Cn%255Cn1.%2520Lorem%2520ipsum%2520dolor%2520sit%2520amet%255Cn2.%2520Consectetur%2520adipiscing%2520elit%255Cn3.%2520Integer%2520molestie%2520lorem%2520at%2520massa%255Cn%255Cn%255Cn1.%2520You%2520can%2520use%2520sequential%2520numbers...%255Cn1.%2520...or%2520keep%2520all%2520the%2520numbers%2520as%2520%25601.%2560%255Cn%255CnStart%2520numbering%2520with%2520offset%253A%255Cn%255Cn57.%2520foo%255Cn1.%2520bar%255Cn%255CnAlternating%2520lists%255Cn%255Cn1%2529%2520first%2520level%2520%2560%253Col%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%252A%2520second%2520level%2520%2560%253Cul%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%2520%25201%2529%2520third%2520level%2520%2560%253Col%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%252A%2520second%2520level%255Cn2%2529%2520first%2520level%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%252A%2520second%2520level%255Cn---%255Cn%252A%2520first%2520level%2520%2560%253Cul%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%25201%2529%2520second%2520level%2520%2560%253Col%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%2520%2520%2520%2520%252A%2520third%2520level%2520%2560%253Cul%253E%2560%255Cn%2520%2520%25201%2529%2520second%2520level%255Cn%252A%2520first%2520level%255Cn%2520%2520%25201%2529%2520second%2520level%255Cn%2522%252C%2522defaults%2522%253A%257B%2522html%2522%253Afalse%252C%2522xhtmlOut%2522%253Afalse%252C%2522breaks%2522%253Afalse%252C%2522langPrefix%2522%253A%2522language-%2522%252C%2522linkify%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522typographer%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522_highlight%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522_strict%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522_view%2522%253A%2522html%2522%257D%257D]. See below for the test example:

{code}
## Lists

Unordered

+ Create a list by starting a line with `+`, `-`, or `*`
+ Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
  - Marker character change forces new list start:
    * Ac tristique libero volutpat at
    + Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
    - Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
+ Very easy!

Ordered

1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
2. Consectetur adipiscing elit
3. Integer molestie lorem at massa


1. You can use sequential numbers...
1. ...or keep all the numbers as `1.`

Start numbering with offset:

57. foo
1. bar

Alternating lists

1) first level `<ol>`
   * second level `<ul>`
     1) third level `<ol>`
   * second level
2) first level
   * second level
---
* first level `<ul>`
   1) second level `<ol>`
      * third level `<ul>`
   1) second level
* first level
   1) second level
{code}
fields.summary: Markdown nested lists fail to render

fields.description: If I have pending (not Saved) comments while reviewing a pull request, and do almost anything else on the page e.g. toggling “ignore whitespace” on one file, all those comments are lost. Either they should be preserved, or at least pop up a warning and let me save the open comments before wiping them out.
fields.summary: Pull request pending comments lost

fields.description:
Let say there are branches *X*, *A*, *B* and *C*.

The _pull-request_ tests are enabled for all branches and _branch specific_ test is enabled for branch *X*.

Upon creating PRs to merge *X* into *A*, *B* and *C*, on each of the 3 PRs, pipeline status shows total *4* pipelines running, 1 for the source branch and 3 for all the 3 PRs.

This is *unexpected*.

‌

Continuing the above scene,

Let say, there is a conflict in the diff of *X*-to-*C* PR. Hence this PR pipeline will fail as soon as it starts running.

Now, since other 2 PRs (to branches *A* and *B*) are also considering the pipeline status of *X*-to-*C* PR, they will also show the pipeline status to be *failed*! Even though those PRs' own pipelines are passing!! When the conflict which caused the fail is not at all related to any of the other PRs' diffs, it should not affect other PRs.

In my case, the above described behavior is blocking the merge of all other PRs.

PS: I did revert the conflicted PR as soon as I spotted the conflict in the diff. But this did not help in any way.

‌

Extra info: I did create all the PRs very quickly one after one.
fields.summary: BB PR pipeline status showing status of all the PRs on same source, in any of the PRs having same source

fields.description:
When loading the [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org] for my organization for some specific commit, Chrome notifies with the icon that:\\
”this page is trying to load scripts from unauthenticated sources”
fields.summary: Bitbucket website is trying to load scripts from unauthenticated sources.

fields.description:
I have a Team setup and neither Admin or Developers are able to successfully create a repo.\\
The page get’s stuck on the loading GIF

‌

!2232131815-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-26%20at%2010.27.31%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Repo Stuck on Loading GIF

fields.description:
The word {{OPEN}} for PR status is mistranslated in German.

The _adjective_ "open" as in "the PR is open" translates to {{OFFEN}} in German.

The German word "öffnen" is a _verb_ that means "to open". Seing "öffnen" is very confusing because it suggests that the PR is not yet open but can be opened by clicking the label.

!2928739888-grafik.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

This is basically the same issue as with the Japanese translation (#16763).
fields.summary: Wrong translation of "OPEN" for PR state in German

fields.description:
Hi,

we have upgraded sbt from 0.13 to new 1.2 and now we see that Bitbucket is running tests two times

1000 instead of 500..
fields.summary: Pipelines show 2 times the number of tests when upgraded sbt

fields.description: The “What’s new” feed contains everything from the Bitbucket blog, which recently has started to include random posts like “Using Apache Solr in Production”. While this content might interest some people, it does not interest me, and I don’t want it appearing as noise in the “What’s new” feed, which should only put a purple dot on the “Help” menu if it contains something relevant to Bitbucket users.
fields.summary: what's new feed contains things unrelated to Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, there's an issue with revert PR if the option "Require issue keys in commit messages" is enabled.

Steps to reproduce:
 # In a repository, go to settings > Links and enable "Require issue keys in commit messages"
 # Create a pull request (e.g. by editing a file from the source browser)
 # Merge the pull request
 # (in the current/old PR view) Click on the "Revert" button

Expected: Reverting should work. If there's not already an issue key in the commit message, it should let me add one (e.g. like the Merge dialog does)

Actual: The popup dialog in the screenshot is shown. Note that it even says that if the pull request includes an issue key..
h1. Workaround

Disable the option to revert or revert it locally.
fields.summary: Unable to revert Pull request if "Require issue keys in commit messages" enabled

fields.description: I get a link to [https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/ekolis/freee/issues/export/zip|https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/ekolis/freee/issues/export/zip] which doesn’t work because that API is gone now. How can I access my exported issues?!
fields.summary: Issue export completion email links me to an obsolete API

fields.description:
Bitbucket clone/pull/push using SSH is taking too much time than usual.

System Asus Zenbook 13  Windows 10
fields.summary: Bitucket SSH actvity taking too much time

fields.description:
Please create a “Create New Pull Request” button on the pull request merge confirmation page after a pull request has been completed/merged. I often have the need to create many pull requests and I always have to go back to the main pull request link to create a new pull request after merging the last one I created. This would save a lot of people a ton of time!

!3715476217-8536518A-8EC6-4376-94B8-8E57D82B0533.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create New Pull Request Button

fields.description:
Many opens source projects which used Mercurial chose BitBucket to host repositories. Now that Mercurial support has been dropped, many repos which are not actively maintained anymore but nevertheless useful for the open source community will be lost.

But this is also an issue for paying customers, which had Mercurial repos in BitBucket. In many external places there may be links to source code or commits in BitBucket. These will all become invalid.

This situation would be less problematic if Mercurial repos in BitBucket are kept in a frozen / archived / read-only stage.

This would also be a positive sign in general. The decision to completely drop Mercurial from BitBucket does not motivate me to choose Atlassian products in the future, because there is this bad feeling that things might go away with relatively short notice.
fields.summary: Preserve Mercurial repos in read-only mode

fields.description:
While using the “Checkout“ option in the branch page, Bitbucket doesn’t add the ”\” to the branches name.

How to reproduce:

# Go to the repository branches page
# Select a branch
# In the top right of the screen, select checkout
# Copy the “checkout in git” content

Expected:

git fetch && git checkout some_branches\'_name

Currently:

git fetch && git checkout some_branches'_name

‌

Workaround:

Manually add ”\” to the checkout command.
fields.summary: Bitbucket UI "Copy to clipboard checkout branch" doesn't add "\" for accents

fields.description:
When trying to view Jira issues in BitBucket’s deployment summary, the user receives the error “User has no permission to access Jira tenant.” if the Bitbucket account they are using is not linked to the Atlassian ID which is being used for Jira.

!1117659500-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-23%20at%201.25.08%20PM.png|thumbnail!\\
All other aspects of the Jira integration work as expected using this configuration including opening linked Jira issues in a modal within BitBucket.
fields.summary: Deployment issue list does not work when using a BitBucket account which is not linked to Atlassian account used in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In "New Pull request experience" the 'Edit' and 'Decline' links in a PR are missing for PR authors that have read only access to the destination repo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 Bitbucket accounts, account-1 and account-2
# From account-1, create repo-A owned by account-1
# Create a fork of repo-A, named repo-A-fork, again owned by account-1
# Grant to account-2 read-only access to repo-A
# Grant to account-2 write-access to repo-A-fork
# Log in to Bitbucket account account-2
# From account-2, create some commits to repo-A-fork
# From account-2, open a PR from repo-A-fork to repo-A

h3. Expected Results
The links 'Edit' and 'Decline' in the PR should be visible to the PR author (account-2).

h3. Actual Results
When "New Pull request experience" is enabled for the 2nd Bitbucket account (the PR author, account-2), the links 'Edit' and 'Decline' are not visible for the user.\\
The links are visible for the PR author with the Old Pull request experience.\\
They are also visible if the PR author has write access to the parent repo.

h3. Workaround
From your Bitbucket account's Settings, go to "Labs" and in there disable "New pull request experience" and enable "Old pull request experience".
fields.summary: In "New Pull request experience" the 'Edit' and 'Decline' options are missing for PR authors that have read only access to the destination repo

fields.description:
Today Bitbucket started failing security checks because it is trying to load javascript from http (not https) sources.

!2230774823-image.png|thumbnail!\\
This problem appears to be more global than just the diff page from pull requests.
fields.summary: This page is trying to load scripts from an unauthenticated source
